Since this is the beginning of the video, there is no prior context to draw from. The question asks how many people ultimately enter the wardrobe by the end of the video. Based on the current segment, no one has entered the wardrobe yet. 

Given the options, we need to consider the possibility of more people entering the wardrobe as the video progresses. However, with only this initial segment, we cannot confirm the final count. Earlier, at [00-01], the two ladies were standing in front of the wardrobe, but no one had entered it yet. The current segment shows the lady in the blue dress being pushed into the wardrobe, confirming that one person enters.

Given the options, Option C (One person enters the wardrobe by the end of the video.) aligns with the observed actions. There is no indication of more people entering the wardrobe in this segment, so other options involving multiple people (A, B, D) are not supported by the current evidence.
